Course Name: ASC 3479 - HUMAN FACTORS AND SYSTEM SAFETY
Prerequisites: HF 300 HUMAN FACTORS I: PRINCIPLES & FUNDAMENTALS
Course Description: THIS COURSE EMPHASIZES THE INTEGRATION OF HUMAN FACTORS IN ALL PHASES OF A SYSTEM'S LIFE-CYCLE. ACCIDENT PREVENTION, BEGINNING WITH SYSTEMS ENGINEERING TOGETHER WITH SOUND MANAGEMENT, ARE COMBINED IN THIS COURSE TO ENABLE THE STUDENT TO FULLY COMPREHEND THE HUMAN'S VITAL ROLES IN PREVENTING ACCIDENTS. THE TOTAL PROGRAM, FROM BASIC DESIGN CONCEPTS THROUGH TESTING, MAINTENANCE/SYSTEMS MANAGEMENT, AND OPERATIONAL EMPLOYMENT, IS FULLY EXAMINED AND EVALUATED.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
THE GOAL OF THIS COURSE IS TO EXPOSE THE STUDENT TO SYSTEMIC VIEW OF HOW HUMAN FACTORS ENGINEERING RELATES TO SYSTEMS. SPECIFICALLY IT WILL REQUIRE THE STUDENT TO READ, UNDERSTAND, AND BE ABLE TO APPLY THE CONCEPTS, THEORIES, AND PRINCIPLES OF SYSTEMS PSYCHOLOGY TO AVIATION AND AEROSPACE SYSTEMS. THE STUDENT WILL BE REQUIRED TO REVIEW THE ASSUMPTIONS AND LIMITATIONS OF THE ANALYTIC TOOLS USED TO INCORPORATE PEOPLE INTO COMPLEX SYSTEMS INCLUDING SYSTEMS TEST AND EVALUATION TOOLS. THIS COURSE IS EXPECTED TO PROMOTE THE APPLICATION OF HUMAN FACTORS CONCEPTS TO THE ANALYSIS, DESIGN, AND EVALUATION OF SYSTEM SAFETY. THIS WILL BE DONE BY EXPOSING STUDENTS TO THE RELEVANT PROCEDURES, TOOLS, AND ISSUES INVOLVED IN SYSTEM SAFETY.

LEARNING OUTCOMES:

1.DESCRIBE THE THEORETICAL UNDERPINNINGS OF SYSTEMS PSYCHOLOGY.
2.IDENTIFY SYSTEMIC ISSUES AND PROBLEMS ADDRESSED BY THE SYSTEMS PSYCHOLOGY RESEARCHERS AND PRACTITIONERS.
3.  READ AND UNDERSTAND THE KEY SYSTEMS PSYCHOLOGY RESEARCH PAPERS.
4.   PERFORM RESEARCH ADDRESSING SYSTEMS PSYCHOLOGY ISSUES UTILIZING RELEVANT HUMAN FACTORS, EXPERIMENTAL, COGNITIVE, AND PERCEPTUAL PSYCHOLOGY LITERATURE.
5.  DEMONSTRATE THE ABILITY TO CRITICALLY DISCUSS DESIGN AND EVALUATION FROM A SYSTEMS PERSPECTIVE.
6.   DEMONSTRATE THE ABILITY TO MAKE A PROFESSIONAL QUALITY PRESENTATION (S) ADDRESSING SYSTEMS PSYCHOLOGY BASED ON THE RELEVANT THEORY AND RESEARCH.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
